result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander M Bruckner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with the Super 8 Motel.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: To perform 30 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
3/02/17 - Court grants 72 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: 14-CF-31, 14-CF-61 & 14-CF-69
To pay the costs of the action. (see attached assessment report for costs owing)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander M Bruckner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: from ADA Korb to court with sentence credit calculations

from Sarah Feltes of Fox Lake Correction Inst. requesting clarification of sentence credit regarding 4 cases for defendant. Court grants 94 days credit for file 14-CF-61, 94 days credit for file 14-CF-69, 72 days credit for file 15-CM-48 and 72 days credit for file 15-CM-167.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defense gives sentencing argument. Defendant makes statement to the court.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 30, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of global offer, requests that case be handled with sentencing after revocation scheduled for tomorrow.  Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Originally set for plea/sentencing. Defense questions exactly what is supposed to be paid up front, requests continuance. State advises that information was sent in July. Court questions whether Defendant has gotten any of the money. Defense advises that Defendant was just released from jail a couple of days ago.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant is on PO hold, requests plea and sentencing in about 30 days. Bond continues as is.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant is trying to get restitution together, requests 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has discovery, has discussed offer with Defendant, has not had time to review discovery.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defense enters not guilty plea. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 4/14/15. (fingerprint card destroyed 11/04/15)
